AttributeList.Text: Used to find the specific runtime of an OB, change the OB number and see the INFO.

Example of Report back the status of the copper link use the extension from the DB .Connected where you need status of connection for the port. Here the HW_ID of the port can be found in the device view>properties>System constants tab
Read XC208 ring connection status of the switches across a span
PnPnCoupler Left and Right Get Diag to see if Device is found on both main module and sub module across the route
Best to place this near and scan right before the RH CNTRL and evaluate PLC State for transfer to faceplate in Advanced Runtime
R_H_Sys_Status HMI status for redundant system operation

Self Latching Sequence using FullSwap Sequence tag, independent function with REQ tag Used to trigger Primary Stop based on input from stop primary and full swap boolean tag; positive edge triggered instruction RH_CTRL below. This network uses a Primary stop request, and evaluates if the RH_CTRL is busy before changing the mode or moving on to the next step. The Retry_Busy tag is used to record if a Busy bit was in place while being triggered to prevent moving mode during middle of RH_CTRL operation.
Modes: 3: Disable execution of the SYNCUP 4: Re-enable execution of the SYNCUP 7: Request SYNCUP system state 8: Request STOP of the primary CPU 9: Request STOP of the backup CPU
Use mode 8 to stop the primary PLC, then use Mode 7 to Synch the primary and backup.

Self Latching Sequence using FullSwap Sequence tag, independent function with REQ tag Used to trigger Sync up; positive edge triggered instruction RH_CTRL below Sequence can also be triggered by Full sequence request which can set the SyncSequenceFlag below SyncSequence Flag is help for next step until run Run-Solo status is reported positive edge triggered instruction RH_CTRL below This network uses a synch up request, and evaluates if the RH_CTRL is busy before changing the mode The Retry_Busy tag is used to record if a Busy bit was in place while being triggered to prevent moving mode during middle of RH_CTRL operation
Modes: 3: Disable execution of the SYNCUP 4: Re-enable execution of the SYNCUP 7: Request SYNCUP system state 8: Request STOP of the primary CPU 9: Request STOP of the backup CPU
Use mode 8 to stop the primary PLC, then use Mode 7 to Synch the primary and backup.
Timer to detect if sequence takes more than alotted time RH_CTRL
